SEARCH
Package ci

Class Builder

java.lang.Object
ci.Builder
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class Builder extends Object implements AutoCloseable
Builder that can run gradle actions on projects. Create a new builder with Builder(Path, OutputStream, OutputStream)} and run runTasks(Consumer, ResultHandler, OutputStream). For example: try (var builder = new Builder()) { builder.runTasks( launcher -> launcher.forTasks("build"), new BlockingResultHandlerinvalid input: '<'>(Void.class) ); } catch (IOException err) { throw new RuntimeException(err); }

  • Constructor Details

    • Builder

      public Builder(Path projectDir, OutputStream buildOutput, OutputStream testOutput)
      Creates a new builder.
      Parameters:
      projectDir - The directory of the project to build.
      buildOutput - The output stream to output the build logs to.
      testOutput - The output stream to output the test logs to.

  • Method Details

    • runTasks

      public void runTasks(Consumer<org.gradle.tooling.BuildLauncher> executeTasks, org.gradle.tooling.ResultHandler<? super Void> handler, OutputStream outputStream)
      Run gradle tasks on the project. Example invocation: builder.runTasks( launcher -> launcher.forTasks("build"), new BlockingResultHandlerinvalid input: '<'>(Void.class) );
      Parameters:
      executeTasks - Allows you to run tasks on the BuildLauncher.
      handler - The ResultHandler, allows you to get the result from the compilation.

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Removes gradle-specific files.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Throws:
      IOException - If it is unable to remove the files.

    • buildAndTest

      public Builder.BuildResults buildAndTest()
      Try to compile the project and run tests.
      Returns:
      BuildResult object with test info and CommitStatuses.failure if the build fails, CommitStatuses.error if the build succeeds, but the tests fail, CommitStatuses.success otherwise.

    • cloneTargetRepo

      public void cloneTargetRepo(String targetRepoUrl, String targetBranch) throws org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException
      Clones repository using provided Url into temporary directory Checks out the provided branch Deletes the temporary directory at the end
      Parameters:
      targetRepoUrl - Url to repository to clone
      targetBranch - Branch from repository to be checked out
      Throws:
      org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException
